gurmukhi: mhw s`qR s`qRM mhwN swD swDM ]mhwN rUp rUpM lKXo bXwD bwDM ]691]
transliteration: Mahaa Sattra Sattran Mahaan Saadh Saadhan|| Mahaan Roop Roopan Lakhyo Byaadh Baadhan||691||
translation: He was considered the great enemy of enemies and supreme saint amongst saints; he was an extremely elegant personality who was the destroyer of all ailments.691.

gurmukhi: qRIXM dyv qu`lM nrM nwr nwrM ]mhwN joD joDM mhwN bwh bwhM ]
transliteration: Treeyan Dev Tullan Naran Nar Naahan|| Mahaan Jodh Jodhan Mahaan Baah Baahan||
translation: He was like god for women and like a sovereign for men; he was a supreme warrior amongst warriors amongst warriors and a great wielder of weapons amongst the weapons-wielders.

gurmukhi: sRuqM byd krqw gxM rudR rUpM ]mhwN jog jogM mhwN BUp BUpM ]692]
transliteration: Sroutan Bed Kartaa Gadan Rudra Roopan|| Mahaan Jog Johan Mahaan Bhoop Bhoopan||692||
translation: He was the creator of Vedas and Shiva for his devotees (ganas). Among Yogis he was the great Yogi and of the Kings, the great King.692.

gurmukhi: prM pwrgMqw isvM is`D rUpM ]buDM buMiD dwqw irDM ir`D kUpM ]
transliteration: Paran Paargadtaa Sivan Siddh Roopan|| Buddhan Boundh(i) Daataa Ridhan Riddh Koopan||
translation: He was the giver of salvation, blissful, adept-like, giver of intellect and the store-house of wealth of powers;

gurmukhi: jhwN Bwv kY jyx jYso ibcwry ]iqsI rUp sO qaun qYsy inhwry ]693]
transliteration: Jahaan Bhaav Kai Jen Jaiso Bicdaro|| Tisiroop Sau Taoun Taise Nihdare||693||
translation: With whatever feeling one looked towards him, he saw him in that form.693.

gurmukhi: sBo ssqRDwrI lhy ssqR gMqw ]dury dyv dRohI lKy pRwx hMqw ]
transliteration: Sabho Sastradharilahe Sastra Gadtaa|| Dure Dev Drohilakhe Praan Hantaa||
translation: All the weapon-wielders saw him as a specialist in weapon-warfare and all the demons who were spiteful towards gods, visualsing him as destroyer of life, hid themselves;

gurmukhi: ijsI Bwv so jaun jYsy ibcwry ]iqsI rMg kY kwC kwCy inhwry ]694]
transliteration: Jisibhaav So Jaoun Jaise Bichdare|| Tisiran Kai Kaadhh Kaadhhe Nihdare||694||
translation: With whatever feeling one thought of him, Ram seemed to him in the same colour.694.

gurmukhi: ikqy kwl bIiqE BXo rwm rwjM ]sBY s`qR jIqy mhw ju`D mwlI ]
transliteration: Kite Kaal Beetio Bhayo Raam Raajan|| Sabhai Sattra Jeete Mahaa Juddh Maalee||
translation: A good deal of time passed during the reign of Ram and all the enemies were conquered after great wars;

gurmukhi: iPrXo c`kR cwro idsw m`D rwmM ]BXo nwm qw qy mhwN c`kÍrqI ]695]
transliteration: Phiryo Chakkra Chdaro Disaa Maddh Raamannd|| Bhayo Naam Taa Te Mahaan Chakkravartee||695||
translation: Ram’s influence spread in all the four directions and he became the Supreme Soverign.695.

gurmukhi: sBY ib`p Awgsq qy Awid lY kY ]BiRgM AMgurw ibAws qy lY ibisstM ]
transliteration: Sabhai Bipp Aagadt Te Aadh Lai Kai|| Bhrigadg Anuraa Biaas Te Lai Bisistan||
translation: All the sages including Agastya, Bhring, Angira, Vyasa, Vasishtha,

gurmukhi: ibsÍwimqR Aau bwlmIkM su A`qRM ]durbwsw sBY ksp qy Awd lY kY ]696]
transliteration: Bisvaamitra Au Baalmeekan Su Attran|| Durbaasaa Sabhai Kasap Te Aad Lai Kai||696||
translation: Along with Vishvamitra, Valmiki, Durvasa, Kashyap and Atri came to him.696.

gurmukhi: jBY rwm dyKY sBY ib`p Awey ]prXo Dwie pwXM sIAw nwQ jgqM ]
transliteration: Jabai Raam Dekhai Sabhai Bipp Aae|| Daryo Dhaae Paayan Seeaa Naath Jagadan||
translation: When Ram saw all the Brahmins coming to him, then Ram, the Lord of Sita and the world ran to touch their feet.

gurmukhi: dXo AwsnM ArGu pwd rGu ]qyxM ]deI AwisKM mOnnysM pRisMnXM ]697]
transliteration: Dayo Aasanan Argh(u) Paad Raghu Tenan|| Daiaasikhanndmaoun- Nesan Prasinnayan||697||
translation: He gave them seats, washes their feet and all the great sages blessed him with delight.697.
